templates.name: Initial Cold Outreach
templates.description: First contact with a qualified prospect after researching their recent news
templates.body:
Hi {{firstName}},

I saw {{companyName}}'s recent {{recentNews}} and wanted to reach out about a strategic opportunity in Southeast Asia.

**The context:** coins.ph is the Philippines' largest licensed crypto exchange with **18.6 million users** and **75-80% market share** in peso-to-stablecoin liquidity. The Philippines ranks **#9 globally** in crypto adoption with a **$38.4 billion** annual remittance market.

**Why this matters for {{companyName}}:**
{{specificValueProp}}

We're BSP-licensed (VASP, EMI, FX) with recent partnerships including Circle and Veem that have shown strong traction in bridging TradFi with crypto rails.

Worth a brief conversation to explore synergies?

Best,
[Your Name]
[Title] | coins.ph & coins.xyz

P.S. — We're also expanding globally through coins.xyz with hubs in Brazil, Nigeria, EU, and SEA.

framework.hook: Reference to their recent news + opportunity
framework.context: Brief credibility statement with key metrics
framework.value: Specific value proposition tailored to them

customizationTips: Replace {{recentNews}} with something specific from the last 30-60 days
Make {{specificValueProp}} about THEM, not you (1-2 sentences max)
Keep the entire email under 150 words
whenToUse: First contact with a qualified prospect
When you have a clear value proposition

templates.name: Follow-up #1 (No Response)
templates.description: Bump the conversation back to the top of their inbox

subjectLines.text: Re: Partnership opportunity: Philippines' $107B crypto market

templates.body:
Hi {{firstName}},

Wanted to make sure this didn't get buried — I know inboxes are brutal.

Quick recap: I'm exploring how {{companyName}} might benefit from partnering with coins.ph (Philippines' largest licensed exchange, 18.6M users, BSP-regulated).

**Specifically thinking about:**
{{specificValueProp}}

If the timing's not right, no worries — just say the word and I'll circle back in a few months.

If it is, I'm happy to:
- Send a one-pager first
- Jump on a 15-minute call
- Connect you directly with our {{technical/commercial}} team

What works best?

Best,
[Your Name]

framework.context: Quick recap of who you are

customizationTips: Reference the original subject line for continuity
Make the 'Specifically thinking about' section even more targeted
Offering multiple options increases response rate
whenToUse: 3-4 business days after initial email with no response
When you believe the prospect is a strong fit

templates.name: Follow-up #2 (Still No Response)

subjectLines.text: Should I close the loop on this?
One more shot — then I'll leave you alone

templates.body:
Hi {{firstName}},

I don't want to be that person who keeps emailing when you're not interested — so this is my last outreach unless you tell me otherwise.

**Here's why I thought this was worth your time:**
{{companyName}} is {{doing X}} and coins.ph has {{18.6M users in the #9 crypto adoption market globally}}. The overlap seemed obvious.

But maybe:
- Timing's off
- You're focused elsewhere
- I got the value prop wrong

If any of the above, just hit reply with "not now" and I'll disappear (gracefully).

If there's still interest, I'm here.

Best,
[Your Name]

P.S. — If someone else at {{companyName}} handles partnerships, happy to redirect. Just let me know.

framework.context: Why you reached out in the first place

customizationTips: The 'Here's why I thought...' section should be your strongest value prop
The 'But maybe...' section shows empathy and reduces friction
The P.S. can uncover if you're talking to the wrong person
whenToUse: 5-7 days after Follow-up #1 with no response
When you want to create urgency without being pushy

templates.name: Value-Add Follow-up (Share Insight/News)
templates.description: Re-engage with value first, no pitch

subjectLines.text: Saw this and thought of our conversation

templates.body:
Hi {{firstName}},

No pitch this time — just wanted to share something that might be relevant to {{companyName}}.

{{industryInsightOrNews}}

**Why I'm sharing:**
Given {{companyName}}'s focus on {{theirFocus}}, this could impact your {{specificArea}}. We're seeing {{relatedTrend}} firsthand through our 18.6M user base in the Philippines.

If you want to discuss how this trend might create opportunities (or risks) for your SEA strategy, happy to share what we're seeing.

No pressure either way.

Best,
[Your Name]

framework.value: Why it's relevant to them specifically
framework.proof: Firsthand data from our user base
framework.ask: Open door for discussion, no pressure

customizationTips: The insight MUST be genuinely relevant to them
Don't force a connection — if it's a stretch, skip this template
Keep the insight brief (2-3 sentences max)
whenToUse: When you have genuinely relevant industry news
As an alternative to 'checking in' emails
To re-engage cold prospects with value first

templates.name: Breakup Email (Final Attempt)
templates.description: Close the loop or get a response

subjectLines.text: One last thing before I go

templates.body:
Hi {{firstName}},

I've reached out a few times about a potential partnership between {{companyName}} and coins.ph, but haven't heard back.

I'm assuming one of the following:
1. Timing isn't right
2. Partnerships aren't a priority right now
3. You're not the right person for this conversation
4. You're just not interested (totally fine)

**Before I close your file**, any quick feedback on which it is? Takes 10 seconds to reply.

If things change in the future, feel free to reach out. I'll be here.

Best of luck with {{companyName}}'s growth.

[Your Name]
coins.ph & coins.xyz

framework.context: List of possible reasons for no response

customizationTips: This template works because it gives them an easy out
The '10 seconds to reply' reduces friction
Some people respond just to be nice — which opens the door
whenToUse: As the final email in a sequence
When you want to either get a response or move on

sequence.description: Recommended email sequence timing and goals

adjustments.companySize: Enterprise = longer sales cycle, more patience
adjustments.capacity: Don't send more than you can follow up on

notInterested.template: Thanks for the response, {{firstName}}. Totally understand — timing is everything. Mind if I check back in 6 months, or would you prefer I remove you from follow-ups?
notInterested.note: Always ask for permission to follow up later or confirm removal

notNow.template: No problem at all. I'll set a reminder to circle back in {{timeframe}}. In the meantime, feel free to reach out if anything changes.

sendInfo.template: Will do. I'll send over our partnership deck and a few case studies. Any specific areas you'd like me to focus on?
sendInfo.note: Ask for specifics to tailor the follow-up

referral.template: Thanks for the redirect, {{firstName}}. I'll reach out to {{newContact}}. If you think a warm intro would help, let me know — otherwise I'll reference our conversation.
referral.note: Offer to let them make the intro if they're willing

whatDoesnt: Too long (gets cut off on mobile)

steps.description: Why they should care (about THEM, not you)
